Body: Description: Customer is experiencing this error on a few of their Oracle database scans, and wants to understand if they are missing any specific roles/permissions that might cause this. @Scottie Taylor​ - Automatic Follow-Up has been disabled because it does not work with the “System Account for web-site.” Please update the ticket with the correct customer account (ask the Partner for the actual customer if necessary) before re-enabling Automatic Follow-Up.

@Scottie Taylor​  - Automatic Follow-Up has been disabled for the following reason:

The account name is set to “System Account for web-site.”

If you have any questions, please see your Support Manager.

Long story short. I'll be asking some questions internally about

sample data in the SQL DC as well as no aic installed and that last analysis of oracle.

Next Steps Updated: Our next steps are:
I will:

Postpone the ticket to allow time to check server credentials. I will reach back out next week for an update.

What We've Learned Updated: Today we:

Investigated an error that was generated during the Oracle SDD Import process. The job that is affected is the 2-Oracle_SensitiveDataScan. 

We replaced the job with a fresh job and attempted to re-run the scan. This resulted in an error as well. We then identified that the AIC wasn't installed which is what caused the AIC table errors on the job.
Steps to Reproduce Updated: Uninstall AIC and run the job again.
